dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our hero, SAM BRENNER, 13, rides his bike through the sub Fast, crazed. CHEAP TRICK’S “SURRENDER” (BUDDAKAN VERSION PLAYS AS CREDITS BEGIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the song continues, WILL COOPER, age 13, is mowing his lawn. His cute LITTLE SISTER is on the sidewalk, operatin a lemonade stand. Brenner arrives, SKIDS his bike to a st Cooper looks at him. Brenner smiles.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRENNER
dialogues.text: It’s open. Cooper abandons the lawn mower, grabs his bike and starts pedal off with Brenner. Then he stops, runs back to the lemonade stand, and takes a big jar of coins.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE SISTER
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenner and Cooper pass a movie theater showing “Polterge and pull their bikes into a parking lot. Each stares ahea awe. CAMERA PANS around them, REVEALS what they’re lookin THE ELECTRIC DREAMS ARCADE. A BIG GRAND OPENING SIGN hang from the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its like going into another world. All the classic games lined up: PAC MAN, DONKEY KONG, CENTIPEDE, SPACE INVADERS GALAGA, Q-BERT, PAPERBOY, ASTEROIDS, BREAKOUT. And they’r all BRAND NEW. The guys enter. Cooper opens the mason jar both guys grab a handful of quarters and they fan out. Brenner waits in line for the holy grail: PAC MAN, watchi OTHERS playing and losing. He studies their moves, the ga controls, taking in every success, every failure. Cooper plays GALAGA. On screen we see him GETTING KILLED THE ALIEN/BUG INVADERS THREE TIMES REAL QUICK. He’s terri It’s Brenner’s turn on Pac Man. He steps up, puts in his quarter and starts to play. Cooper steps up, watching ove his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG COOPER
dialogues.text: Which one’s the alien, Sam, the cheese wedge guy or the rainbow blobs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 2.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRENNER
dialogues.text: Neither. Those blobs are ghosts, and the cheese wedge is Pac Man. He’s a... I don’t know what he is, but he seems like a good guy. Cooper shakes his head, looks at the game Brenner's playi cU of an 80’s 8 Bit video screen as PACMAN RACES ACROSS I

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG COOPER
dialogues.text: Wow. How are you so good at this game? You’ve never even played it before.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRENNER
dialogues.text: I don’t know. There’s a pattern to how they are moving. Watch... He does. ON SCREEN the game seems to slow down. We see numbers and arrows superimposed over the action in Brenne eyes. He knows exactly where the ghosts are going, when t bonus cherries are going to appear, etc.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG COOPER
dialogues.text: I don’t see it. But you sure do. CHEAP TRICK’S SONG continues as CREDITS PLAY OVER: - MONTAGE of Brenner playing: Centipede, Q-Bert, Galaga, Defender being played at a high level (intercut with othe 80s kids, janitors, etc. watching slack-jawed), high scor after high score, crowds growing, “SAM” taking over the entire top ten scores. - As a huge crowd has gathered around Brenner, Cooper pla “the Crane Game” by himself in a lonely corner. He deftly maneuvers the claw over an array of stuffed animals and rubber masks. Cooper lowers the claw over a Chewbacca mas the claw grabs it, but it gets stuck. Will Cooper get it? CUT TO Brenner playing ASTEROIDS, surrounded by a respect crowd. He steps away from the machine.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRENNER
dialogues.text: Sorry, folks, I gotta eat. His guy “dies”. The crowd applauds and pats him on the ba as he walks over to Cooper - standing there in the Chewba mask. He hands Brenner a “Reggie” bar.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG COOPER
dialogues.text: You can’t stop playing, can you? You're like a video game addict.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRENNER
dialogues.text: You don’t understand, buddy. I suck at sports, I suck at school. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 3.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRENNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Video games is the first thing I’ve ever been good at.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG COOPER
dialogues.text: You're not “good” at video games, Sam - you're the best. (hands him flyer) And it’s time to show the world. Brenner reads the flyer - “WORLD VIDEO GAME CHAMPIONSHIPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Super Bowl of video games. Hundreds of PEOPLE are the NEWSCASTERS report. Cooper is massaging Brenner’s fingers

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRENNER
dialogues.text: I can’t believe I’m doing this, man. I wish you’d signed up too.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG COOPER
dialogues.text: I stink at every game. Except for the crane-claw thing.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRENNER
dialogues.text: You're good at everything else, Chewie: talking people into things... Making up stories... Brushing your hair just right... Looking like you're smarter than you really are...

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG COOPER
dialogues.text: Yeah, what’s that gonna get me? He trails off as he overhears someone nearby talking...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Hi... This is a pretty good party...Actually, I hate parties... Brenner looks over to the next machine to see LUDLOW LAMONSOFF (8, glasses. Genius, no social skills). Ludlow playing CASTLE QUEST (made-up 8 bit game) and talking und his breath to the LADY LISA character (we see her beautif illustration on the side of the machine).

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG LUDLOW
dialogues.text: You too? That’s so funny. My name’s Ludlow by the way... Well nice to meet you, Lady Lisa... Really? I think you're pretty darn foxy yourself... He finally notices Brenner and Cooper staring at him and embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 4.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRENNER
dialogues.text: You're the wonder kid, Ludlow Lamonsoff, right? Heard you're pretty good. *

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Who told you that? The government? Cause they've been tracking me. I’m close to figuring out the secret of the Bermuda Triangle, and the “powers that be” aren’t too happy about it.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG COOPER
dialogues.text: Wow. You don’t have any friends, do you?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Just my mom. He gestures toward his MOM, who is sitting on a stool in corner, holding a bag lunch and a six-pack of Yoo-Hoo. Sh shrugs and waves. *

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRENNER
dialogues.text: Well, you can hang out with us too. * They shake hands. * There’s a hubub at the front door: EDDIE PLANT has arrive He’s dressed in parachute pants, a Twisted Sister T-shirt a rat tail, and is flanked by two hot 80’s looking girls leather pants (their t-shirts identify them as the CYBER GIRLZ).

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: What’s up, geeks and goobers? They call me the Fire Blaster. Because my hands are blazing fast, and also I will blast and burn all my competitors’ weak-ass moves. * Eddie saunters over toward Ludlow.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG EDDIE PLANT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You must be the local talent. If this was an ugly contest, I'd be in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRENNER
dialogues.text: At least we didn’t make up our own nicknames, Fire Blaster.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: Who cares who came up with it? It’s totally tubular!  Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 5. Brenner and Eddie glare at each other. An MC steps on sta M.C. Welcome, gamers, to the First * Annual Arcade World Championships. * We have representatives here from the Guinness Book of World Records, as well as NASA, who will be videotaping tonight’s competition * to be included in a compilation of 1982's news events and popular culture. That video tape will be placed in an orbiter that will be * launched out into the solar system * to search for proof of Extra- Terrestrial life. (ET voice) ET phone home! People APPLAUD, IMPRESSED. Eddie Plant makes the “choke” at Brenner. Brenner shakes his head. Ludlow, nervous, loo like he is gonna piss himself as they head to the games. Cooper cheers them on. It’s like the OLYMPICS as they all step up to play, total seriousness. There are about a dozen competitors: mostly boys but a punk chick and some weird middle-aged men (one wearing a Karate Kid headband) mixed in. We see them move controls, put their quarters in and pound the buttons in MO as the judges watch all the contestants. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Brenner plays BREAKOUT zen-cool as slo-mo Cooper cheers on. -Ludlow is sweating profusely playing GALAGA. His mother next to him, holding up a Yoo-Hoo for him to sip from. -Eddie is kissing one of the Cyber Girlz as he annihilate PAC MAN. He lowers his sunglasses over his eyes, then rea starts kicking ass. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -ONSTAGE, the M.C. addresses the crowd dramatically.

dialogues.speaker: M.C., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, what an evening we've had here: six new US records set, three new world records set, and now, when the smoke clears, we have... a tie! 259 points for your new Pac Man world champion... The Fire Blaster, Eddie Plant! (applause) And 259 points for your new Galaga and Centipede world champion... rookie sensation Sam Brenner! * (shocked applause) Gentlemen, shall we break this tie? * (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 6.

dialogues.speaker: M.C., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s play-- (a beat) Donkey Kong! ! Brenner and Eddie both smile confidently. They start walk toward the machines.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BRENNER
dialogues.text: Good luck, man.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: I don’t need luck, nerd. Cause if I lose right now, I go home knowing I don’t got what it takes; a nothing, a failure, someone who looked Destiny in the eye and blinked. And the Fire Blaster never, ever blinks. Eddie stares unblinking at Brenner as they insert their quarters. They play furiously. The Cyber Girlz cheer on Eddie; Coop Ludlow and Ludlow’s Mom cheer on Brenner. Brenner starts pull ahead, Eddie’s in deep trouble. But then Eddie lower his sunglasses, gets serious and starts mounting an improbable comeback.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG COOPER
dialogues.text: Finish him, Sam! But Eddie is suddenly racking up the points. We see BRENN POV: he’s lost the pattern. He rubs his eyes; the focus i gone. ON SCREEN, through Brenner's eyes, the game is actu speeding up, the superimposed arrows and numbers getting scratched out and changing direction rapidly. Eddie and Brenner are each down to their last guy, playin their hearts out, until we hear... the DONKEY KONG death sound. But who died? Eddie turns to Brenner.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: Congratulations - on being a loser! Brenner steps back from the machine. Stunned. WE PUSH IN on the look of utter disappointment and devastation on his face as he realizes he lost at the one thing he was great at, as Eddie rants on in the backgroun

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: YEAH!!! Fire Blaster is the WORLD

dialogues.speaker: HANDLE THE PRESSURE
dialogues.text: (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 7.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: HE CAN SUCK IT! And YOU CAN SUCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “SAM BRENNER”. A NAMETAG. CAMERA PULLS BACK. It is PRESEN DAY. The nametag belongs to the actual ADULT BRENNER, pin to his BRIGHTLY COLORED ORANGE JUMPSUIT, that identifies as being in the NERD PATROL. He carries a clipboard and is miserable, depressed. He st up to the front door of a GEORGETOWN MANSION and KNOCKS. HANDSOME, YOUNGER FIT MAN, answers.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: (like he wants to die) Hello, I am a NERD from the Nerd Patrol here to deal with your audio/visual needs. The Fit Man turns and walks inside, calling out.

dialogues.speaker: FIT MAN
dialogues.text: The nerd’s here! Brenner sighs, he hates his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenner installs a 70 inch 4K Sony TV to the wall of a gigantic living room. As Brenner lifts the TV to mount it the wall, he glances outside, through a large picture win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENNER’S POV: The handsome home owner lies on a lounge chair, beside his GORGEOUS WIFE. They drink champagne, watching their TWO BEAUTIFUL CHILDREN relax on rafts, * drinking smoothies, in their state of the art pool. * Brenner watches them, with a longing for a life he’ll nev know. His expression says it all: Must be nice.

dialogues.speaker: THIRD CHILD, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Pretty sweet life, eh? * Brenner, startled, drops the TV, which smashes. * Brenner sees another kid (7) standing nearby, in a polo * shirt, looking smug, drinking a smoothie. *

dialogues.speaker: THIRD CHILD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sucks to be you, nerd. *

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Yeah it does. Got any tape? *  Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still in uniform, Brenner sits across from COOPER also 45 is dressed in a blue blazer and open collar shirt. They’r eating lunch at a table near the bar.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Look, Chewie, I don’t know why I’m giving you romantic advice; you always did way better with chicks than I did.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Not always. Remember that chick in Ft. Lauderdale? The redhead who was all over you?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: That was my cousin. Moving on. If I were you, I'd take one hour a day where you shut down the phone, turn off the email, the ESPN, put down the Reggie bar and just devote your full attention to your wife.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: I can’t shut off my phone and email, man; I gotta be reachable 24/7. Not all of us work out of a van.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Yeah, I get it, I have a crappy job. I’m a failure, I wear orange shorts, my wife left me for a busboy...

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: Don’t give me some sob story, Brenner. You were meant for something more than this.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Why would you think that? I was never really good at anything.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: You were good at one thing. Best I ever saw.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Second best. And playing old-timey videogames ain’t a real lucrative career path nowadays.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: Hang on, I gotta see this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 9. Brenner turns. ON TV WE SEE CHRIS MATTHEWS on MSNBC.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS MATTHEWS, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: The President’s gaffe-filled summer continued today during an appearance at Joseph Knibb Elementary School to promote his new youth reading initiative. Here’s what happened... ON TV WE SEE Cooper in a classroom, reading to a class of FIRST-GRADERS who have gathered on the rug around him. Parents, teachers, etc. stand watching excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: (dramatic) .--But then, Mittens jumped up on to the table, and knocked over the whole bowl of soup! Mrs. Pickles gassed - gasped, and the whole room fell silent. “This is casta... (struggling with word) catsa... catatastrophic?...”

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL, (SUNNY)
dialogues.text: Catastrophic!

dialogues.speaker: COOPER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: (a little loud) I got it, thanks, sweetheart! The Little Girl looks like she’s about to cry. ON TV, back to Chris Matthews.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS MATTHEWS
dialogues.text: Seems like if the President's approval ratings don’t improve, the results of the next election could be... catsatatsastrophic. Back in the bar, Brenner is laughing.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: You really should learn how to read.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: I was on three hours sleep!! We pull back further and see that there are A TON OF SECR SERVICE AGENTS there. People are peeking in the windows excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Dude, I gotta get out of here; I got a 2 o’clock install. You getting this, or...  10 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 10. Cooper just stares at him, looking sheepish.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m getting this?!

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: I forgot my wallet! Brenner turns to the AGENTS, disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Could one of you seven guys grab his wallet before he walks out the door next time?! Please? I’m broke, he’s the President!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLOUDY night sky. Behind the clouds, we see the eerie i of a LARGE ALIEN CRAFT. We can’t make out any details. Suddenly, A WIDE LIGHT PORTAL OPENS. We HEAR A CLICKING SOUND. From out of the clouds, we see a cloud of BRIGHTLY-COLORE CUBES. They loop down from the stars and FORM A STREAM. I TIGHT FORMATION. The cubes TURN and FLY DOWN A DIRT ROAD, their intense FO sends waves of POWERFUL WIND through the trees. The cubes ZOOM PAST A SIGN THAT READS: ANDERSON AIR FORCE BASE. GUAM, USA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A modest house. A door opens. A 13 YEAR OLD KID stands th

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Are you the Nerd?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: No, I just like to wear this because I think I look awesome. (the kid just stares at him) Yeah, I’m the Nerd.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Isn't that kind of demeaning?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Only if someone brings it up.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: I won’t bring it up then.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Lovin’ it. es

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matty leads Brenner in. He looks around. It’s a warm hous

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: So what am I installing?

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: A new 85 inch SONY 4k 3D TV. Playstation 4. 7.1 Surround sound speakers. Really, if you guys sell it, we bought it.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Wow, is it your birthday?

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: My parents are getting a divorce.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Oh, that’s like ten birthdays.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: My Dad cheated on my Mom with his 18 year old pilates instructor. Her name is Sinnamon with an S. I shit you not; that is her name. I mean I should be dating an 18 year old pilates instructor, not him.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: She'd break you in half, dude, but I get your larger point.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Anyway my Mom kinda hates him right now for being a major d-bag asswipe, her words, not mine. She felt bad that I’m going through this so she sold his Porsche on Ebay to buy me all this-

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay, Matty, we don’t need to tell the nice installer man our whole life. Brenner turns and sees VIOLET KELLY (LATE 30's) beautiful smart, tough. Brenner sees her and then involuntarily utt

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, whoa what?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: (embarrassed now) .»-No, just you...whoa.  12 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 12.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Me, whoa? I don’t know what that means.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: ..-Yeah. Um, it’s just when your son told me that your husband left you for an 18 year-old I kinda thought maybe you * were one of those hot-when-we-met-in high-school, but then got-older-let- herself-go and now has like neck fuzz and a pot belly with cottage-cheese thighs. But that’s clearly not what you look like. So more like whoa, I should have probably brushed my teeth before I left the house, or studio apartment, if * we're getting real here.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Do you have Tourettes?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Surprisingly no. Wish I did right now. Violet laughs. There is definitely a connection. Matty no

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, I guess I should start setting all this stuff up.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Alright, go get ‘em. * Violet and Matty walk out. She turns and catches Brenner looking and he pretends he was looking at her light fixtu instead. She smiles to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bustling, filled with military personnel. CAMERA PANS to HANDSOME SAILOR, staring intently at a video monitor. AN ARRAY OF COLORFUL SHAPES appear on the monitor, MOVING TO the center of the screen. The HANDSOME SAILOR’S face fall he SHOUTS to someone OFF CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: HANDSOME SAILOR
dialogues.text: Captain Devereux! You need to see * this-- CAPTAIN DEVEREUX, a tough, middle aged hatchet of a man w a crewcut, walks up, stares over the sailor’s shoulder. H eyes widen in shock.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN DEVEREUX
dialogues.text: We’re under attack!  Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 13. 13 INT. VIOLET AND MATTY’S HOUSE - LATER - DAY 13 Brenner is setting up the video game system. Matty is han out, watching him. Brenner notices him.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: So you a gamer?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Uh, I was when I was your age.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Were you any good?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: I was alright at some of the classic games.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Classics? You mean like “Halo”?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: No, the real classics: Pac-Man, Asteroids, Space Invaders. Games you played at an arcade, which was a building outside of your house. You’d go with your friends, there was great music playing, cute girls everywhere...

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: I like games where you shoot people, and their guts go flying everywhere, and occasionally you have to rip someone's spine out and then use to it to beat someone else to death. It’s probably genetic.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Why? Your mom’s a serial killer?

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: No, she makes weapons for the military.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (overhears this) Matty, what are you saying?...

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Nothing, Mom. Sorry I mean she works as a waitress at P.F. Changs at the mall. (then mouths to Brenner) No she doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: (mouths back) Really?  14 15 16 17 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 14.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: (whispers) She says she’s gonna’ make a Whore Destroyer Weapon to take out Sinnamon. They laugh. Violet walks in.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: What are you guys talking about?

dialogues.speaker: MATTY/BRENNER
dialogues.text: Video games. Violet smiles. Then she gets a text, her face falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos. SERVICEMEN RUN OUT to man their posts. They hear t noise. BEEP BOP. BEEP BOP BOOP. That familiar arcade game sound. FIGHTER PILOTS run down the tarmac towards their j EXPLOSIONS coupled with VIDEO GAME SOUNDS FILL THE AIR. O PILOT stops before getting in his plane, looks up at the BLURRY COLORFUL IMAGES are REFLECTED IN HIS HELMET.

dialogues.speaker: FIGHTER PILOT
dialogues.text: What the hell are those things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTS FLICKER ON AND OFF in the command center. EXPLOSIO ROCK the interior. A WALL IS BLOWN AWAY, sending people flying to the ground. The explosion is UNLIKE ANYTHING we ever seen. The wall PIXELATES INTO A HUNDRED COLORFUL BLO leaving a HUGE OPENING, FILLED WITH SMOKY COLORFUL LIGHT. The HANDSOME SAILOR get to his feet, runs outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SAILOR RUNS OUTSIDE, looks up to the sky. He is STUNN by what he sees. He is suddenly BATHED IN LIGHT. He raise his PISTOL and begins firing upward. Suddenly the pistol LEAVES HIS HAND and is PIXELLATED UPW INTO THE LIGHT. This is followed by the SAILOR, whose bod PIXELLATES. The PIXELS rise up... DISAPPEARING INTO THE LIGHT... INT. VIOLET’S BEDROOM - DAY 17 Brenner knocks on the door and peaks his head in.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Mrs. Kelly? Just wanted to let you know I’m all finished and I need you to sign the work order... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 15.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET, (FROM THE CLOSET)
dialogues.text: Um, mostly crying. A little drinking. Probably equally crying and drinking.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Something I do often also, but why in the closet?

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: I don’t want Matty to see me. We then hear more sobbing sounds. Brenner isn’t sure if h should leave or not. He sighs, and heads towards the clos

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: I’m gonna’ open the door now, Mrs. Kelly. I’m coming in.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: (still crying) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the door and sees her feet. He climbs in. Violet sitting behind the clothes. Mascara drips down her cheeks

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: I’m sobbing on the floor of my closet, drinking chardonnay out of a sippy cup. Does it look like I’m alright?  19 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 16.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: I withdraw the question. Do you... want to talk about it?

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: No, yes, I don’t know. She reaches for him and cries on his shoulder. He awkward pats her on the back.

dialogues.text: Babe? So Saturday, I was supposed to have dinner with the King of Saudi Arabia to discuss a trade agreement, but I decided to cancel.

dialogues.text: Well, I made a reservation at this new place on Michigan Avenue, where you go and actually make a cake. You mix in the flour and eggs and whatever, then they bake it for you, but you get to frost it- vanilla, chocolate, butterscotch - then you can make a design with sprinkles and sparkles if you want. So I thought it could be fun if you and I-

dialogues.text: I could ask.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: I thought it was just a fling, a mid- life fling-thing, but now according to the text I got 20 minutes ago he’s Marrying her. My son's stepmom is gonna be named Sinnamon. (makes a disgusted face) This just isn’t where I thought I’d be at this point in my life.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’11 drink to that. They toast with sippy cups.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: We were high school sweethearts. The perfect couple. He proposed in a waterfall. An effin waterfall. We had our problems, sure. But now I’m almost 40 and getting a divorce and he’s marrying an 18 year old named after a spice... and it’s not even spelled correctly.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: I think you need to take a deep breath... and then go find him and Sinnabuns and set them on fire.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: (laugh/cries) Yes, I mean no. That would be fun though.  Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 18. She stops crying. He wipes her tears away, they exchange

dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: I mean... You got the worst part over with. You already married the wrong guy...

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: True.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Maybe it just means you’re gonna’ meet the right guy.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Yeah. Brenner looks at her, waits a beat, then LEANS IN FOR THE KISS. She quickly backs away.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Um... a little? *

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: I thought we were having a moment. * She gets up, exits the closet. Brenner follows, walking w her into the kitchen. * 21 INT. VIOLET’S BEDROOM/STAIRCASE - CONTINUOUS 21 *

dialogues.text: We were, but- Look you seem like a nice man. But I just met you. And no offense, I * don’t think my rebound guy is a 210 pound * dork who installs flatscreens for a living. *

dialogues.text: First of all, 208. And wow. I * didn’t peg you as the snobby type.

dialogues.text: Snob? Me? No, I’m not a snob!  Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 19. A22 INT. VIOLET’S KITCHEN - CONTINUOUS A22 * Violet makes two cups of Nespresso coffee, gives one to B

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Okay, so if I was a billionaire and we were in the Mediterranean on my gigantic yacht and we were sipping Champagne and I * went to kiss you, would you? Busted. Before she can answer Brenner’s phone rings. He l at it. It says “PRESIDENT CHEWIE” on the caller ID.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: While I’d love to stay and hear you lie about not wanting to make out with the yacht guy, I have to go. Also I’m an * amazing kisser. You had a chance to find out and you just lost it. As he exits the kitchen, HER PHONE NOW RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.text: Brenner is speeding along in his van, but has to stop for red light. A car skids to a stop beside him. It’s Violet. Brenner rolls down his window, calls to her.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, Stalky. It’s * over. Deal with it. The light changes, and he peels out. 30, 40, 50 mph. Bren looks in his rear-view and sees Violet is right on his ta

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to himself) Wow, she went from zero to psycho in 6.7 seconds...

dialogues.text: We see Brenner’s van racing through the mostly empty stre toward the White House. Violet’s car is right behind. The both put their blinkers on at the same time to head into.

dialogues.text: Brenner pulls up to the guard shack and hands the GUARD h ID. He speaks softly and quickly.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Steve, there’s a woman with mental * problems right behind me. You might need to call for back-up or break out * the stun gun--- * Violet's car pulls up and the GUARD waves her through.

dialogues.text: Brenner and Violet walk quickly down a hallway in the Wes Wing. They notice what a HOTBED OF ACTIVITY THE WHITE HOU IS. Everyone is WORRIED, PANICKED. The PRESIDENT’S ASSIST (Jennifer) sees them approaching.

dialogues.text: Lieutenant Kelly, you can go right * into the Situation Room. Violet turns to Brenner, cocky.

dialogues.text: Cooper leans against his desk, worried.

dialogues.text: You couldn’t have at least changed?

dialogues.text: You told me to come right over! Chewie, what’s going on? It’s crazy out there.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Yeah, where do I know that from?... Hold it! Stop! (the footage freezes) Can you go in tighter? The footage zooms in a little. A strange ship comes into focus.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That can’t be real...

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: So you're seeing the same thing I’m seeing?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Yeah, unless we’re both having the same weird dream...  Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 22. The door opens, and the President's Assistant Jennifer wa in.

Violet i one of a group seated in chairs against the wall, taking notes. The PRESS SECRETARY walks beside Cooper as he make his way to the head of the table.

dialogues.text: Mr. President, we told the press that it was an advanced weapons test that misfired. So there’s no mass panic yet.

dialogues.text: Well, it’s like, alien ships Just turkey, plain turkey... swarm in a symmetrical manner Do they have chipotle and rain light bombs on, mayo?... Is it fat free? Can like, your guy-- I get it on the side then?

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE SECRETARY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Mr. President. Jennifer asked what we wanted. I figured we were gonna’ be here for awhile--

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: (to his Assistant) Just get us a bunch of turkey sandwiches, okay?! (sees Navy Sec’s pleading) ..+-with chipotle mayo... (more pleading face) -..on the side. (sighs, then to CIA Chief) So someone is attacking us in the form of spaceships from a 1980s video game. The question is who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 30 Brenner watches the tape of the attack again. Then he see something and pauses the footage. He studies it closely.  Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 24.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE SECRETARY
dialogues.text: (hopeful) The sandwich guy? A beat of silence, then...

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah. This is... my... old arcade game technical consulting advisor person, Sam Brenner. He works... in the tech sector.

dialogues.text: Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 25.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: World.

dialogues.text: The Galaga that attacked us actually doesn’t exist anymore. *

(points at the screen) But this is from the original 1982 arcade version. Those machines were * recalled and reprogrammed because of * glitches in the original code. You can tell by the way the giant space bugs swoop in.

dialogues.text: (watching) Kind of ziggy-zaggy.

Our nation has been attacked by an unknown military force, and we must respond swiftly and decisively. If it got out to the press that we were pinning the blame on an old contuter game, they wouldn’t just * mock you on the news, Mr. President: they’d impeach you! So I * suggest the man in the orange shorts leave the room immediately, so those of us with long pants and government positions can discuss our options! All eyes turn to the President.

dialogues.text: Brenner. Brenner screams and gives Ludlow a backhand punch in the face. Ludlow falls back, but then tumbles forward as Bren slams on the brakes, almost driving off the road. Brenner grabs Ludlow by his shirt, then recognizes him...

But sometimes the conspiracies are real. Remember when we were kids and were in the Video Game Championship? (Brenner nods) Remember how they put a tape of the event * and all the games we played in that orbiter that they shot out into the universe looking for Extra Terrestrial life? +e HHH  Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 29.

The next battle (STATIC) is in 15 hours, at coordinates twenty-seven (STATIC) twenty-four, seventy- (STATIC) -nine. The message ends. Ludlow HITS STOP. Pull back to REVEAL w in... dialogues.text: Brenner, Cooper and Ludlow were watching this on a flatscreen.
