dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: --And we've already lost the first battle! If we lose two more, they will completely destroy our planet.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: So where do Mr. T and Michael Jackson fit in?

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: The aliens must be shapeshifters! In that orbiter NASA also included movies, music and other current events of 1982, to tell other civilizations about us.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: What are they gonna hit us with * next? If I’m remembering right, * there were at least a dozen games we played that night back in ‘82. * Breakout, Galaga, Asteroids, Pac Man, Dig-Dug, Donkey Kong--

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Donkey Kong. Not your finest hour, Sam. *  37 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 32.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Shut up, Lud, or I’1ll have Chewie pass a law against eating Hot Pockets in your underwear.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Unconstitutional! Look, assuming those numbers alien Mr. T gave us are latitude and longitude, the next attack will be somewhere in northern India, tonight. If you can get your NSA techs to clean up the signal, we can pinpoint the exact location, and maybe even what game they’re going to play--

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: Look: this is an interesting theory. But I can’t authorize a military response based on this crazy Ronald Reagan/Mr. T video. It looks like something a couple of high school kids made.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Well, you gotta at least warn the Indians that something might be coming--

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: I’m known as a buffoon right now as it is. I can’t the risk, Ludlow. I just can’t. Brenner and Ludlow exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. TAJ MAHAL -— DAWN 37 An excited INDIAN GUY (early 20s) is with a beautiful IND GIRL outside the Taj Mahal. He seems nervous. He takes hi iPhone out, pushes some buttons, and a tinny INDIAN VERSI of Spandau Ballet’s “TRUE” begins to play. He props it up record himself. He stands facing the Girl, speaks some Hindi, then drops one knee. The Girl can’t believe this is happening! Behind them, we see... something. Flashing lights, someth bright whizzing through frame too fast to see. The couple oblivious. The Guy speaks some more heartfelt Hindi, gett emotional, then pulls a ring box out of his pocket. The Girl, finally noticing what’s going on off-camera, st screaming. The Guy thinks she’s screaming about the ring nods cockily.  38 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 33. But then he sees what’s going on and starts screaming, to He grabs the camera, but never gets a clear shot of what’ going on, just quick low-rez images of lights, smoke, him and -- He LOWERS the camera. For a few moments, we see the DESTRUCTION of the TAJ MAHAL. Is it being TORN APART by t game... BREAKOUT! A bright light APPEARS above the Indian Guy. The girl STE BACK. TERRIFIED. The boy LOOKS UP. He SCREAMS, as his fac becomes PIXELATED and SEPARATES INTO TINY PIXELS. The pie are LIFTED INTO THE AIR... INT. DARPA —- CORRIDOR - DAY 38 An elevator opens in an antiseptic hallway, revealing Coo Brenner and Ludlow. Brenner is giving Cooper a hard time.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: (doing impression) “I can’t take that risk, Ludlow. I just can’t.”

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: Aw shut up.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: (Indian accent) “He knew what was coming, but did not help us? Why?”

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: (threatening) Hot Pockets. Violet (in a lab coat) comes down the hall to greet him.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Morning, Mr. President, I-- (sees Brenner and Ludlow) What’s Johnny Surround Sound doing here? And this other... fella?

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: I’m Ludlow Lamonsoff! This is awesome! You smell nice!

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: Mr. Lamonsoff and Mr. Brenner have agreed to share their video game expertise with you and your team.

dialogues.speaker: OF
dialogues.text: Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 34.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: With all due respect, Mr. President, having civilians with zero security clearance in this facility is--

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: These gentlemen have a better handle on what’s going on right now than anyone in my entire * administration. You should be welcoming them, not questioning * their security clearance.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Of course, Mr. President. Gentlemen, right this way. * Brenner gives Violet a cocky look. She smirks back and le them through the hallway, into a LARGER ROOM, where VARIO TECHNICIANS and SCIENTISTS construct and design prototype for the latest military weapons.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: So have we made progress, Lieutenant? *

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Enormous progress, sir. We now believe those things that attacked us were made of energy, intelligent energy. A cool mecha-animal dog comes bounding down the hall towa them. A SCIENTIST follows, taking notes.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: Morning, Lieutenant. *

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Good morning, Michael. As the Scientist passes, Brenner and Ludlow see his backs wires, machinery, electrodes: the Scientist is a ROBOT. Ludlow is ecstatic.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: (excited whisper) Michael’s a robot!

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Handle your high, Ludlow.  Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 35.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Think about it: we as a civilization have been harnessing light for a hundred years and in that time we’ve created electricity, lasers. Things that people a century ago couldn't begin to comprehend. But it’s possible that this civilization has been doing it for millions of years. So there’s no telling what they’re capable of.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Wow, are you a robot too? Violet rolls her eyes. Ludlow pauses at a table where a g of SCIENTISTS work on VARIOUS HIGH TECH WEAPONS. Ludlow stares at all of the weapons, in awe.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Whoa... Best day of my life... Ludlow picks up an iPad-like remote control--

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: Hey! ! May I help-- ALL OF A SUDDEN a small drone rises off the table into th air and begins shooting randomly. Everyone ducks for cove Scientist grabs the remote out of Ludlow’s hands.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: My bad. REVEAL Michael the Robot down on the other side of the ro He has a smoking hole in his back, revealing smoldering circuits and wires.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL THE ROBOT
dialogues.text: I’m okay. No permanent damage. (green gel dribbles out of his mouth) All good. They continue walking.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: I think maybe the extra- terrestrials took what they saw in the orbiter and re-created those same things out of light energy and then sent these light creatures back at us. That’s why solid matter like bullets, missiles, won’t harm them.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: Well, have you come up with anything that will harm them?  Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 36.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Maybe... They walk up to a different table, where another Scientis (not a robot) is taking notes over a high tech cage, stud something inside: a single PIXEL.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The cube we recovered in Guam has * proven nearly impossible to * analyze, but we’ve been able to * reverse engineer some prototype weapons that seem to neutralize it. * We're basically hitting it with * super-charged light particles. *

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Light guns?

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Light cannons, actually. These cubes are pretty feisty. Violet sticks the eraser-end of a pencil into the cage an pokes the pixel. The pencil pixellates, and the original pixel rattles around the cage superfast; the Scientist struggles not to drop it.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: That’s awesome. Can you show us the * whore destroyer now? *

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: You’re so smart. Is that how you * got into the Mississippi Institute * of Technology? *

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: You know I wish I never went into that closet with you. Also, I deeply regret trying to kiss you. Cooper and Ludlow turn and look at Violet and Brenner. Vi resumes walking; they follow.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Moving on. We've begun instructing the Navy SEAL task force on the use of the prototype weapons. * They've finally reached a huge door at the end of the roo

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe our new “expert advisors” would like to say a few words?  39 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 37. She hits a button, opening the door, revealing a hangar w a group of 50 TOUGH NAVY SEALS have gathered. They all tu to Brenner and Ludlow with hard stares. INT. DARPA —- HANGAR - DAY 39 Cooper, Violet, Brenner and Ludlow stand behind Admiral Porter.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL PORTER
dialogues.text: Men, you've served this nation with distinction in combat zones in every nook and cranny of this god- forsaken world, defeating every enemy they’ve thrown at you. And now, you are going to face, and I can’t believe I’m saying this, aliens from outer space. The SEALS look at each other, roll their eyes. Brenner spots Matty in the back of the crowd (with his bookbag), and nudges Violet.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: What’s his security clearance?

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: I couldn't get a babysitter.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: That's why I had to bring him. Brenner points to Ludlow, who’s nervously rocking in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL PORTER
dialogues.text: Now these aliens, probably for their own sick amusement, are going to attack us in the form of “video games”. So, to help us develop defense strategies and counter- tactics, the President has brought in - and I really can’t believe I’m saying this - these two civilian “arcaders,” who we are now required to listen to for 120 seconds. Admiral Porter stalks off. Brenner and Ludlow (extremely nervous) step forward, to a silent reaction (except for Matty, who smiles excitedly).

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: (whispers to Brenner) I think I’m gonna puke.  Numbered Script (04/17/2014)

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Just be confident. Act the part. We know how to do this stuff. They don’t. Ludlow nods, taking this to heart. They now stand in fron the surly SEALS.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you for that warm introduction, Admiral. My name is Sam Brenner. And this is- Ludlow shoves Brenner out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: YOUR WORST NIGHTMARE! Looks to me, Brenner, like SOMEONE FORGOT TO SEND US THE BEST OF THE BEST and instead dropped off a bunch of... incontinent adult-diaper- wearing... candyass... cries-themselves-— -to-sleep-women-baby... man-people!

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: (sotto) Too confident...

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: From now on, maggots, you little... girl Maggots, ---whatever the name for the female form of maggots is! From now on when you poop, WHEN YOU POOP YOUR PANTS YOU'RE GONNA BE THINKING OF ME! So TAKE

dialogues.speaker: LISTEN THE EFF UP
dialogues.text: (yells in one Seal'’s face, spittle flying) Do you feel me, sailor?! DO YOU

dialogues.speaker: FEEL MEEEEEEE
dialogues.text: The SEAL is about to kill him. Matty is trying hard not t laugh. Brenner steps in.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Ludlow, I think you’re gonna feel his fist in the back of your skull if you don’t take two steps back. of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ludlow takes two steps back, trembling. Brenner addresses troops.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, I know it must seem weird that two buffoons like us would be giving advice to you badasses, who put your lives on the line every day to protect us. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 40 4l 42 43 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 39.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But we spent our childhoods training our prefrontal cortex to perform extremely complex motor feats with hand eye coordination unique to a very specific cognitive acuity, which is meaningless in all other areas of life, but suddenly might come in handy for saving the planet. (quick look to Admiral Porter, whispers) I learned a lot of big words at those dorm room drug parties. (back to troops) So we hope you guys can get past us being civilian morons and let us show you a few moves in whatever time we have. Then...

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Lud, let it go.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: You got it, buddy. Ludlow nods. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC
dialogues.text: -Rows and rows of VINTAGE ARCADE machines have been set u different NAVY SEAL stands over the controls of each vide game, as Ludlow and Brenner pace behind the SEALS stoppin every now and then to give a piece of advice. Brenner STO at one machine... CENTIPEDE. He gives specific directions the Navy Seal, who is trying to grasp it. Ludlow steps in to dramatically demonstrate a specific mo ("keeping the wrist loose”); the SEAL stares at him angri -A blueprint is on a table. Violet refers to it as she 41 barks orders to UNDERLINGS, who are making some pretty hi tech shit. -Brenner is playing Asteroids, and the game is being 42 displayed on a giant screen. The SEALS are sitting watchi taking notes. It’s crazy how good Brenner is; Matty is watching with new-found respect. -Cooper is at the “make a cake” store with the KING OF 43 SAUDI ARABIA doing the frosting as they discuss a free-tr agreement. Jennifer the Assistant runs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 44 45 46 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 40.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Mr. President, we just received a message on the UHF signal from the “Where’s the Beef?” lady! The next battle is on at sundown tomorrow: 51/30/29 latitude, 0/9/42 longitude.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: Where the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot of London, England.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUMVEES roll down the road toward the park. Brenner and Ludlow sit in the back, face to face with the SEALS. Ludl smiles at the SEALS; they don’t smile back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop in a big open field, and disembark from the Humvees. A curious SOCCER PLAYER walks over to Ludlow.

dialogues.speaker: SOCCER PLAYER
dialogues.text: What’s all this then, mate?

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: We’re Americans! These navy guys have gotten permission from your government to prepare for an extraterrestrial invasion which we believe will occur here in the next two hours. The Soccer Player just stares at Ludlow. Then a British S OFFICER traveling with our guys chimes in.

dialogues.speaker: SAS OFFICER
dialogues.text: We're shooting a beer commercial.

dialogues.speaker: SOCCER PLAYER
dialogues.text: Right then. As he jogs off to rejoin his game...

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Why’d you lie to him? Shouldn’t we be clearing the area?

dialogues.speaker: SAS OFFICER
dialogues.text: Trying not to cause a total-panic situation, Yank. (to Ludlow) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 47 48 49 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 41.

dialogues.speaker: SAS OFFICER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I don’t want to hear another word out of you. Ludlow looks cowed. But his mood instantly changes when Violet opens the back of one of the Humvees, revealing...

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: And then there were... light cannons. High tech, sleek, insanely cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot of the Prime Minister’s residence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President sits with the BRITISH PRIME MINISTER and so aides and advisors, watching footage of Hyde Park on seve monitors.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: Mr. Prime Minister, I can’t thank you enough for your cooperation on this.

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: Of course, Will. The Commonwealth is at your disposal. I trust we'll duff up these jiggery pokers straight away, and resume the profoundly ordinary summer of gloom we were heretofore luxuriating in.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: I know, right? After a beat, he turns to the Junior Aide and whispers. PRESIDENT COOPER (CONT’D) (confused) No idea what he just said.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR AIDE
dialogues.text: Your response made sense, sir.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: That’s why they call me “da prez”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SEALS are taking the light cannons out of the Humvees Violet seems nervous.  50 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 42.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Easy with those! We don’t have any backups! Admiral Porter strides over.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL PORTER
dialogues.text: These ray guns gonna work, Kelly?

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: We had no way to field test them, sir. But most of our computer models showed a resonable degree of effectiveness.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL PORTER
dialogues.text: Reasonable degree?! You're sending my men into battle with untested ordinance?!

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: I had two days! To do things never done before on this planet!

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL PORTER
dialogues.text: Remember who you're speaking to, Lieutenant! The gruff SAS Officer calls out.

dialogues.speaker: SAS OFFICER
dialogues.text: Anybody who doesn’t need to be here should follow me to the support area, now. (to Brenner and Ludlow) That means you geezers. Move it. Brenner and Ludlow start walking away, kind of bummed. Brenner sees Violet is shook up.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Hey, Lieutenant: it’s gonna work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper, the PM and their aides are watching Fox News with SHEP SMITH on one of the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: SHEP SMITH
dialogues.text: Our military was attacked. And what does the President do? His specialty - nothing! MEGYN KELLY chimes in.  51 52 53 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 43.

dialogues.speaker: MEGYN KELLY
dialogues.text: That’s not true, Shep - he made a cake with King Abdul! Footage of Cooper happily making the cake.

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: Turn that off. Apologies, Will.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: They always seem to catch us doing goofy stuff, eh, Nigel?

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: Rarely that goofy, but I do understand the sentiment.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: (fake smiles, then into speakerphone) Anything, Lt. Kelly?

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET, (INTO HER WALKIE-TALKIE)
dialogues.text: Eerily quiet, Mr. President-- It is quiet, except for a rhythmic groaning noise coming the walkie-talkie. It almost sounds like... sipping. BACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Defense Secretary is nervously sipping tea in the cor He notices the President and everyone else staring at him

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE SECRETARY
dialogues.text: It’s very hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The park is pretty crowded. Brenner squeezes between two metal barriers and walks over to the SAS Officer

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Hey, dude, I just thought of something I should tell the SEALS about the pattern if it’s Space Invaders--

dialogues.speaker: SAS OFFICER
dialogues.text: Please return to the support area.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: I’m just trying to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 44,

dialogues.speaker: SAS OFFICER
dialogues.text: (grabs Brenner’s shirt) If we need you, we know where to find you. Brenner turns and walks back behind the barrier. Suddenly, there is THUNDER. LOUD THUNDER. CLOUDS have sta to materialize out of the peaceful sky. Above the clouds see LIGHTS. It’s very magical. And terrifying. At the nearby soccer game, someone takes a shot on goal, another player deflects the ball sky-high with his head. then the ball doesn’t come down. Then they see why: A SPACESHIP, MOSTLY HIDDEN BY CLOUDS HEADS TOWARDS THEM. Brenner and the others all MARVEL at it. THE SHIP’S PORTAL OPENS. Then THINGS START TO FALL FROM T CLOUDS. They look like GIANT MUSHROOMS. Everyone braces f impact, then the giant mushrooms stop mid air. They start HOVER and FORM A PATTERN IN THE SKY.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: It’s Centipede. The SEALS “hooo-rah” and sprint off to their attack positions. Brenner yells instructions from the other side the fence.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Remember what we talked about! Kill each centipede from the head down! If you hit it in the middle it will break in two.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Then you have two snakethings. Hit it again, four snakethings. We do not want four snake-things! The cocky Seals ignore them and take aim at the night sky And then THEY COME. GIANT CENTIPEDES just like from the o arcade game come to life. THE CENTIPEDES NOW EVOLVE FROM 8 BIT look to more realistic creatures. They are TERRIFYI

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh God. Oh God. This is really real. The GIANT CENTIPEDES SLITHER DOWN FROM THE SKY, THROUGH T MUSHROOMS. EACH HAS A DIFFERENT PERSONALITY. One CACKLES. Another has A GIANT MOUTH FULL OF TEETH, constantly CHOMP at the air. Another GROWLS AND SCREAMS. Yet another HISSE Also unlike the game that existed on a solely Two Dimensi Plane, this is REAL LIFE and THREE DIMENSIONAL. The creat attack from all ANGLES.  54 55 56 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 45. The Seals start SHOOTING UPWARDS. THE LIGHT CANNONS EMIT LASER BLASTS THAT RESEMBLE THE GAME. One of SEALS’ beams HIT A CENTIPEDE’S HEAD. IT PIXELLATES cheer goes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone cheers. Cooper pumps his fist, psyched.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: The light cannons work!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet looks back at Brenner and smiles gratefully. As he smiles back, he mutters to himself. *

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: G-d she’s hot... * Then a SEAL fires up at a Centipede and hits it in the middle. IT SPLITS IN HALF.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: NO, NO!!! DIDN’T WE JUST SAY DON’T SPLIT

dialogues.speaker: HEAD
dialogues.text: The Seals are NOT USED to these things: the weapons or th prey. They FIRE UP at them. But KEEP MISSING.

dialogues.speaker: SEAL
dialogues.text: THE MUSHROOM-THINGS. They’re in the way!

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: SHOOT THE MUSHROOMS! It’s just like the game. If they get down to the * ground it’s gonna get really bad, really quick. The Seals FIRE UP at the mushrooms and centipedes. They h a mushroom which now sends a CENTIPEDE STRAIGHT DOWN TOWA A SEAL. He doesn’t see it.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: SGT. DUFF!! 12 O’CLOCK! TOO LATE. THE CENTIPEDE CHOMPS UP SGT. DUFF AND scurries quickly off into the bushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole room watches in shock.  57 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 46.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Nooooooo! It ate the Sarge! The centipede ate the Sarge! The remaining Seals continue to SHOOT SKYWARD. They are a freaked out by what just happened. Another CENTIPEDE STRE

dialogues.speaker: BACK AND FORTH ACROSS THE SKY DOWN TOWARDS THEM LIKE A
dialogues.text: VICIOUS FLYING SHARK. The Big Seal shoots at it. But it’s FAST. He KEEPS MISSING.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: No, shoot right... Now left! Look, you can’t just fire at where they are, they’re too fast. You have to watch the patterns, anticipate where they’re going to_be and shoot there!

dialogues.speaker: BIG SEAL
dialogues.text: I DON’T KNOW THE PATTERNS! It’s moving fast down towards them, CLOSER AND CLOSER. It SCARY MOUTH BITING AWAY. Finally Brenner can’t stand it. leaps over the barrier, shoves the SAS Officer to the gro and sprints toward the SEAL.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Brenner! No! Brenner grabs the light cannon from the Seal and STARTS

dialogues.speaker: FIRING AT THE CENTIPEDE. BLAST BLAST BLAST
dialogues.text: Piece by piece Brenner BLASTS it, just like in the game. as it dies we see it RETROGRADE BACK FROM REAL-LOOKING

dialogues.speaker: FINALLY TO PIXELS OF ENERGY THAT DISSIPATE INTO THE AIR.
dialogues.text: dissipated pixels BRUSH PAST Brenner's face.

dialogues.speaker: BIG SEAL
dialogues.text: Nice shooting, civilian.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: I’m not just a civilian. I'ma nerd. He looks at Ludlow and makes a decision.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ludlow, grab a light cannon and get over here!

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Me?! No! NO! I LOOK DELICIOUS, HE’LL EAT

dialogues.speaker: ME TOO
dialogues.text: 58 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 47.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: These guys don’t know this game! We were born to do this! The SEALS look to Violet. Violet talks into the walkie- talkie.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Mr. President? A beat of silence, then...

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (quietly) Let the nerds take over.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: What was that, sir?

dialogues.speaker: LET THE NERDS TAKE OVER
dialogues.text: A SEAL hands his light cannon to Ludlow. Ludlow looks at Brenner, terrified. Then...

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Lud... hit the start button.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: (takes a deep breath) What am I worried about? I’m the Wonder Kid. The two of them turn skyward and start blasting away. THE BOTH KICK ASS. A SCREAMING CENTIPEDE FLIES DIAGONALLY DOWN FOR LUDLOW. LUDLOW BLASTS IT. IT BREAKS IN TWO RIGHT BEFORE it hits h The two pieces HIT THE GROUND and SLITHER AWAY. But LUDLO quickly nails them both with a cool spin move.

dialogues.speaker: OF TIME. THE SPIDER EXPLODES INTO A SHOWER OF PIXELS IN T
dialogues.text: ADMIRAL’S FACE.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: You're welcome, homeboy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone watches this.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: YEAH, BOYS! Shock and awe! High score, bitches! He turns, sees everyone staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: You heard the president. Cheer them on! Everyone in the room starts cheering raucously.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Only one left!! Daddy’s got ya... Brenner points to the REMAINING CENTIPEDE. But it breaks right quick, MOVING TOWARDS THE CITY! Brenner FOLLOWS it of the park, as Ludlow, consumed with blood-lust, continu shooting crazily into the sky. EXT. PARK LANE - NIGHT — CONTINUOUS 60 The Centipede RUNS OUT into the street. PEDESTRIANS freak out, RUNNING AWAY. Brenner runs out in hot pursuit. The Centipede RUNS TO AN APARTMENT BUILDING and BURSTS through the FRONT DOORS, MOVING INSIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Centipede dashes UP THE STAIRS. Brenner CHARGES AFTER The Centipede CRASHES through the FIFTH FLOOR door, into hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OLD WOMAN is exercising along with a “BUNS OF STEEL”, English workout TV show. THE CENTIPEDE BUSTS THROUGH THE and PASSES the TV. The woman doesn’t notice, obsessed wit her workout. The Centipede TURNS BACK and STOPS beside th woman. The creature is mesmerized by the TV show, by the music... The Centipede MIMICS the movements of the workou beginning to exercise along with her... Brenner RUNS INSIDE, takes aim at the Centipede.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Why are you here? What do you want?! The Centipede turns TOWARD THE WINDOW. Brenner FIRES, MIS the Centipede and BLOWS APART THE TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 63 64 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 49.

dialogues.speaker: ME TELLY
dialogues.text: The Centipede LEAPS THROUGH THE WINDOW. CRASH!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CROWD of people are gathered outside, seeing the CENTIP BURST OUT THE WINDOW, FLYING DOWN TOWARD THEM. They TURN RUN OFF. Except for a LITTLE BOY. He stares, in shock, at flying centipede. It’s HEADING RIGHT DOWN TOWARDS HIM. Time slows down. Brenner, pissed off, appears at the wind and TAKES AIM. THE CENTIPEDE OPENS ITS MOUTH. ONLY A FEW FROM THE BOY. In SLO MO BRENNER FIRES! BLAST BLAST BLAST! The tail end hit and disappears again and again, the Centipede getting shorter and shorter til it’s just the head, opening it’s mouth to eat the boy... THE LAST BLAST HITS IT. The centi DE-RESES AND PIXELATES INTO NOTHING. The Little Boy smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOY
dialogues.text: Who are you, Mister?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Son, I’m just a guy who’s good at old videogames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guys, Violet, the SAS Officer and the Seals are in th PACKED BRITISH PUB WITH A TON of Brits. The mood is celebratory. Ludlow stands on top of a table, raises his glass...

dialogues.speaker: DRINKS ARE ON THE U.S. GOVERNMENT
dialogues.text: The packed bar SCREAMS AND TOASTS. LUDLOW (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: HOOVER DAM
dialogues.text: The packed bar IS CONFUSED. Brenner raises a glass to the guys and the Seals.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: To Sgt. Duff, who gave his life for our freedom.  Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 50. As they all drink to him, Brenner turns to see Violet smi at him.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: You’re a good man, Brenner. Sorry I was so rough on you.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: I appreciate that. And in exchange for your apology, I am getting you drunk! I’m just letting you_know in advance. Which is the gentlemanly thing to do because as far as you know I’m a gentleman.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: You can try. But just so you know I was the tequila shot record holder in my class at West Point. So it ain’t gonna be easy. They clink shot glasses. Violet downs hers, Brenner throw his over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: That’s one... Violet laughs. The doors to the bar fly open and SECRET SERVICE COME IN followed by the President. The PATRONS ALL CHEER HIM.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: Where are my gamers at? Cooper kneels between Brenner and Ludlow, and puts his ar around them. PRESIDENT COOPER (CONT’D) Looks like all that time you wasted when we were kids is finally paying off. The now-drunken SAS Officer stands and holds up a pitcher

dialogues.speaker: SAS OFFICER
dialogues.text: Sir? Might I pour you a frosty?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: Hey: I am the President of the United States, and a President can’t be seen drinking during a time of crisis... (loosens his tie) So nobody look! Cooper grabs the entire pitcher. The crowd CHEERS. As Coo raises it to his lips...  65 66 67 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 51. Every TV in the pub crackles to life. We see a bit of ONE TREE HILL. IT BREAKS UP. 80’S BORN IN THE USA era BRUCE SPRINGSTEEN comes on screen.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE SPRINGSTEEN
dialogues.text: Congratulations. You have(STATIC) won this battle. (STATIC) Please accept one of our warriors as a trophy of your victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Old Woman who we met before is sitting on the couch i her trashed apartment eating biscuits. A BEAM OF LIGHT suddenly shines in the window. Pixels swo in and form into the DOG from the game DUCK HUNT. It hops the couch and snuggles against her. The Old Woman pets it

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: Well aren’t you a cute one? Give us a kiss, luv... The Duck Hunt Dog licks her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stares silently at Springsteen on the TVs.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE SPRINGSTEEN, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: The next challenge will not be (STATIC) as easy. The details will be sent via this (STATIC) signal shortly. Remember, we are still leading two battles to one. (STATIC) one more loss for you will mean (STATIC) the annihilation of your world. Springsteen goes into a windmill move on his guitar, then TV screens fade back to black. The celebratory mood has instantly turned funereal.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: Alright, you heard The Boss. Let’s get back to work. We gotta get you guys ready for the next battle.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Us?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: No, we're not the guys, Chew. We just stepped in to stop it from going wrong. Today was a fluke.  68 69 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 52.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: A fluke? You guys single-handedly repelled an alien attack! The world needs you right now. Cooper looks at Brenner very seriously. PRESIDENT COOPER (CONT’D) Remember when I told you that you were meant for something more in life? This is it, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: He’s right, Brenner. I hate to admit it, but you’re the best.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Not at every game... The meaning of this sinks in.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Oh please God no.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: I don’t want to see him either. But we might need him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper, Brenner and Violet are led into the prison by the WARDEN. Violet now opens up the vet file on EDDIE PLANT.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Eddie Plant: Married and divorced four times, declared bankruptcy in 1991 and 2004. In 2005, he was caught hacking the cell phone companies and adding one of those fees you see on your bill every month but have no idea what it is, made about 50 million before he was convicted and sentenced to twenty years in prison. This guy a good friend of yours?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: As I remember, we pretty much hate each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Warden leads Brenner and Violet into a room. Adult ED PLANT is here. He wears a goatee, a mullet and a few tatt When Brenner walks in, Eddie acts mock-terrified.  Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 53.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: Warden, get me outta here! It’s that mean centipede killer! I hope he don’t zap me with his space gun!

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Hello, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: S'up, Second Place. And your sidekick, he really made something of hisself. (before he can say thanks) I didn’t know you could have an approval rating that “catatastrophic”. I think the warden in here is more popular than you.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: Alright, here's the deal... In exchange for you helping us, I will personally talk to the parole board about reducing your sentence.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: (sits back smugly) Pass.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: Pass?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: That deal doesn’t work for Eddie Plant. If you want the Fire Blaster’s help, he has some demands.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Who's the Fire Blaster?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: Me! That’s my nickname!

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Oh right, the one you made up.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: Who cares who came up with it?! It’s totally tubular! Look I’ve been watching the news. I know what’s going on out there. And I further know that he despises my white ass-

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Noooooyes.  Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 54.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: So you wouldn’t be here unless you really really needed my help. Which gets me back to my original point: I have some demands.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Like what? Eddie sits back and pulls out a handwritten list of deman

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: I want an island.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Oh g-d.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: There are 18,617 named islands that are part of the United States and its territories! Not to mention all the countless unnamed ones.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: You're not getting an island.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: Then I want a full pardon. I want to get out of here for good. And after I do I want to pay no more taxes like forever. Like if technology improves and I live forever I want to pay no taxes, for-ev-er! Not even sales tax, if I buy some for instance gum, I want a card that says I saved the world and I don’t have to pay no shitballs taxes on gum. I want one of those Stealth Attack Helicopters that they fly over the Super Bowl-- at my disposal at all times to fly my white ass around. If the world is still here I don’t want to have to deal with traffic anymore. And lastly I want you to set up a rendezvous with me, Taylor Swift and Jamie Lee Curtis in the Lincoln Bedroom. Cooper stands and walks out. Brenner goes after him.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Chewie! Cooper stops, and he and Brenner speak with quiet intensi in the doorway, out of earshot.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: I can’t do this, Sam.  Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 55.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: We can’t do it without him.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: He’s going to mess this up. He’s going to screw us over. They look back at Eddie, who’s blowing kisses at Violet.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: He’s no day at the beach. But I think a lot of this is just a front. We’re giving him the chance to be a hero. Even assholes like him want to be a hero.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: I don’t know, man...

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: You gotta trust me. Cooper thinks for a beat, then walks back to the table.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: 1) You're not getting a helicopter or any sort of flying or driving vehicle. 2) I think the Federal Government can probably do without your income taxes and be okay. But sales tax you’re on your own. And 3) IF you help us beat these things... I think we can get you out of here.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: -.-And the Swift/Lee Curtis sandwich?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: Pick one of them. (disgusted) We'll see if we can set up... a coffee.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: Jamie Lee Curtis. And we are closed. Eddie smiles and puts out his cuffed hand to shake Cooper Violet's phone rings. She answers, nods, then hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: It’s happening tonight.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER AND COOPER
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: New York City.  70 71 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) CUT TO Eddie Plant, holding his crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The greatest city in the world.

70 71 A military trucks pulls up, and Violet, Brenner, Eddie (w sunglasses on his head) and Ludlow hop out. They get chee Ludlow can’t believe it. The guys are wearing DARK BLUE “ARCADER” SUITS. Eddie has GPS BRACELET on his ankle.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: Hello Big Apple, the cavalry has arrived! The POLICE COMMISSIONER walks over.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE COMMISSIONER
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming. We saw how you guys handled the Centipede, and hope you can do the same for us.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: I hope so too. So what are we dealing with? The Commissioner calls over a ROOKIE COP. He is draped in blanket, shaken up.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE COMMISSIONER
dialogues.text: Rookie! Tell ‘em what you saw. The Rookie Cop comes over, his eyes saucers of fear.

dialogues.speaker: ROOKIE COP
dialogues.text: It... it came out of the clouds. And then it started attacking. Devouring everything in it’s path. It was awful! It was like a scene out of a monster movie, you know? Except this time the monster was real...

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Alright. And who was this monster?

dialogues.speaker: ROOKIE COP
dialogues.text: P-p-p-pac Man! The Arcaders all laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 72 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 57.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Pac Man? That little yellow rascal’s got you this worked up?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: (fired up) All right let’s get those lasergun- deals and blast this bodyless eating machine back to whatever planet it came from so I can get my pardon.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: That’s not how you defeat Pacman. He gets vaporized by a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: Okay. So where do we get us some ghosts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the street we see FOUR MINI COOPERS -- Each of them painted a color like the GHOSTS from Pacman. Violet points to a high tech METAL CONTRAPTION ATTACHED T THE ROOF OF EACH OF THE MINI COOPERS.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: We used the energy force field technology from the cube to develop 4 mini generators for each of the cars/"Ghosts.” We’re calling them 2950 Attack Modules.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: And we're calling ‘em “Ghost Coopers.” But there’s four of them, and only three of us. Who’s our fourth? An older Japanese man, TORU IWATANI, steps forward. He is wearing a jumpsuit like Brenner, Ludlow and Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: May I introduce Professor Toru Iwatani... the inventor of Pac Man.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: (bowing) Iwatani-san! The honor, is mine. Domo arigato!

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Sir, you're a genius. Thanks for all the pleasure you’ve brought to our lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 73 74 Numbered Script (04/17/2014)

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: I made your game my bitch!

dialogues.speaker: PROF. IWATANI
dialogues.text: What is... “beetch”?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about that, Professor. Welcome aboard. Let’s get to work. 58. The guys go to their cars. Brenner, nervous but trying no show it, struggles with strapping himself in. Violet sees

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Here, I‘ll help you. She helps strap him in.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Assuming they follow the rules of the game like they did with Centipede, if you guys hit Pacman three times with this energy field, we win.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Ludlow was right: you do smell nice. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Good luck. She walks off. Brenner smiles and starts the Ghostcooper

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a traffic jam of people trying to get out of the city. POLICE HELICOPTERS circle overhead. The four Mini Coopers RACE across the bridge, being led by a heavy POLI ESCORT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys drive the four Ghostcoopers with licence plates

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 74 that say INKY, BLINKY, PINKY AND CLYDE down the street. They s to each other on comms.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Why am I Pinky?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: At least you're not Blinky. How can you be a badass driving Blinky?  75 76 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 59.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: I love being Clyde. Clyde’s cool. Clyde’s for real.

dialogues.speaker: PROF. IWATANI
dialogues.text: Enough jibber-jabber! It does not matter which ghost you are! (to himself, delighted) As long as I’m Inky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Violet at a command center.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET, (INTO THE COMMS)
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, I’1l be sending Pac Man's current coordinates to each of your car's GPS’. Failure is not an option. EXT. MANHATTAN STREETS — NIGHT 76 The Ghostcoopers roll into the city. We see PEOPLE FLEEIN DESTRUCTION. It’s like a scene out of a Godzilla movie. We hear the FAMILIAR SOUND OF PACMAN MOVING, EATING, but on a grander scale. They HEAD towards the noise. It’s get LOUDER AND LOUDER. They round the corner and see THE PACMAN. He is like a gi yellow, three dimensional version of the one from the gam CROWDS OF PEOPLE flee from him. The slower ones are DEVOU by Pacman, along with abandoned cars, motorcycles...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: Look at the size of that thing! It looks like Barry Bonds’ head!

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: I can’t believe Pac-Man’s a bad guy. Prof. Iwatani is near tears, stunned by what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: PROF. IWATANI
dialogues.text: Pac-Man is not bad! I created him to bring joy to all the people of the world! They have brainwashed him! Deep down, he is gentle, kind, someone you could tell your troubles to, or grab a hamburger with... You’ll see! Prof. Iwatani gets out of the car and APPROACHES Pac-Man.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Professor Iwatani! What are you doing?!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 77 78 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 60.

dialogues.speaker: PROF. IWATANI
dialogues.text: I will talk to him. He is my son. Prof. Iwatani approaches Pac-Man, who studies him suspiciously. PROF. IWATANI (CONT’D) Hello, my sweet little boy. Look how big you have grown! I am proud of you. But these destructive things you are doing, they are wrong. I am your father... Prof. Iwatani gives him a warm smile, REACHES OUT TO TOUC PAC-MAN... PROF. IWATANI (CONT’D) And I know you are a good boy-- Pac-Man OPENS HIS MOUTH and CHOMPS OFF Prof. Iwatani’s ha He SCREAMS, as the top of his wrist PIXELATES AWAY. PROF. IWATANI (CONT’D) Aaaaaah! Kill this stupid beeeeetch!! Prof. Iwatani turns and RUNS AWAY, DISAPPEARING DOWN the street, among the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: That was some crazy Pinocchio shiz- nit right there. Pacman GLARES at Brenner. They stare at each other for a moment. Then Pacman QUICKLY TURNS and starts heading in t OPPOSITE DIRECTION.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: Alright losers, three on one, let’s hit it! THE THREE REMAINING GHOST-COOPERS HAUL ASS and TAKE OFF A PACMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA follows behind Pacman as he FLIES DOWN the street. eats a COMMUTER BUS. Just like the game he TURNS ON A DIM FLYING down another street. The GHOSTCOOPERS chase after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Handsome Homeowner from the beginning of the movie, h gorgeous wife and their three kids are watching the Pac-M attack on their taped up TV (it looks kind of like an OJ style car chase). A headshot of Brenner appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e HHH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79 80 81 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 61.

dialogues.speaker: THIRD CHILD
dialogues.text: Hey, that’s the nerd who broke our Tv!

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: He’s faster than I remember. Brenner SHIFTS into high gear and FLOORS IT. The three Ghostcoopers are nipping at its heels, but Pacman is STIL FASTER.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: Pac Man’s always been faster than the ghosts. We’re gonna have to out maneuver his ass. Wonder Fro - you and Brenner break off. I’1l stay with Big Yellow. In their cars, Brenner and Ludlow TURN OFF in a different direction. Eddie is in HOT PURSUIT. WE SEE Eddie lower his sunglasses. INT. MANHATTAN —- STAGING AREA - NIGHT 80 Violet looks at the SATELLITE FOOTAGE AND MAPS OF THE STREETS. We see Eddie’s car CHASING after Pacman on the screen, while Ludlow and Brenner's cars move into positio flank him. With THE GRID OF THE CITY AND HIM EATING THE S CARS IN HIS PATH IT REALLY DOES LOOK LIKE THE GAME.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Alright, you need to start thinking about how to trap him--

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Huh? Eddie, how did you do that so fast?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: Cause I’m the champ, sugar buns! Ludlow, turn right at the next intersection; Brenner, turn left and then he’s cheese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pacman continues CHOMPING his way through traffic. Eddie now zooming toward him. Pac Man tries to double back, but BRENNER AND LUDLOW’S CA

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Nope. *

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Sorry. * Eddie SLAMS INTO THE BACK OF PACMAN! WE HEAR THE NOISE FR THE GAME WHEN A GHOST KILLS PACMAN. Pacman SCREAMS. He lets out a BIG ROAR that rocks the cit

dialogues.speaker: ONE DOWN
dialogues.text: INT. MANHATTAN —- STAGING AREA - NIGHT 82

dialogues.speaker: TWO TO GO
dialogues.text: Violet looks at the satellite footage.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, Iwatani Son Number 2 just re- * generated four streets away, now heading northbound. So turn east at the next intersection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenner, Ludlow and Eddie are back in pursuit of Pacman. INT. MANHATTAN —- STAGING AREA - NIGHT 84

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Okay... Brenner stay straight. Ludlow go left. Fireblaster right. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three Ghost-Coopers ROLL DOWN various streets. Brenne HOT on Pacman’s tail. Pacman TURNS A CORNER. ALL THREE CA CLOSE IN.

dialogues.speaker: WE GOT HIM
dialogues.text: All of them smile. Then Brenner sees something and their FACES FALL.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Oh dip. *

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Oh dip what? Oh dip what?! *  87 88 89 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Pacman and the Three Ghostcoopers on three sides o him. Then on the fourth side we see...A GIANT POWER PILL! PACMAN EATS IT. He STARTS TO GLOW AND SHAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenner still flooring it in reverse as Pacman chases him with a vengeance like the T-Rex in Jurassic Park.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: What’s happening?!

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: A power pill! He’s got ten seconds where he can eat us. Brenner then makes a HARD TURN. He looks and Pacman is GO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ludlow stops. Looks around. He doesn’t see him anywhere. is breathing heavily, hyper-ventilating. Then in his REAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ludlow HITS the gas. Pacman CHASES HIM, he’s FASTER than Ludlow and QUICKLY CATCHES UP to the Ghost-Cooper. Pacman opens his mouth and... BITES OFF THE BACK HATCH of Ludlow car. Leaving a GAPING HOLE. LUDLOW, EYES WIDE, SCREAMS! Freaked out Ludlow FLOORS THE GAS. But Pacman is still CHASING HIM, STILL CHOMPING. Pacman TAKES ANOTHER BITE and gobbles up the ENTIRE REAR SECTION of the car. Ludlow is literally driving on TWO WHEELS. His seat the only thing separating him from Pacma who is still in HOT PURSUIT. Only a FEW INCHES from gobbl up Ludlow. He tries to jump, but his seatbelt is JAMMED! emits a girlish scream, keeps pulling on his seat belt. About to be Pac-food, Ludlow HITS THE BRAKES, causing the to SPIN around, facing Pacman, whose mouth OPENS WIDE...

dialogues.speaker: OPEN BACK OF HIS VEHICLE RIGHT AS PACMAN EATS IT
dialogues.text: Again we hear the DEAFENING GHOST-EATING SOUND. Then Pacman’s power boost finally runs out. Ludlow lies on the ground, defenseless without his GhostCooper. PACMAN NOW STARTS COMING AFTER LUDLOW.  90 91

dialogues.speaker: A92
dialogues.text: 92 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 64. Ludlow takes off RUNNING down the street as Pacman CHASES HIM.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Don’t do this! You’ve been * brainwashed! You're a good boy! * Pacman is about to EAT LUDLOW WHEN EDDIE’S GHOSTCOOPER BL INTO HIM FROM THE SIDE. PACMAN SCREAMS AGAIN. DIES.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: You just got fireblasted, sucker! Ludlow sighs, then PASSES OUT on the ground. INT. MANHATTAN —- STAGING AREA - NIGHT 90 Violet looks at the command map, confused.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: How the hell did he get over there so fast?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Nice work, Eddie. One more and it’s * happy hour. *

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: Cake. They spot Pac Man moving away at the far end of a long av They shift their GhostCoopers into high gear and speed af side by side. But then Eddie really floors it and zooms a

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: YOU DON’T MESS WITH THE *

dialogues.speaker: FIREBLASTER
dialogues.text: Eddie, doing about 120, gets really close when Pac-Man su turns left. Eddie, going too fast, can’t negotiate the tu continues on straight - right into New York Harbor. EXT. NEW YORK HARBOR/INT. EDDIE’S GHOSTCOOPER - NIGHT A92

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: The Fireblaster can’t swim! * INT. MANHATTAN —- STAGING AREA - NIGHT 92 *

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: We're sending a boat! Brenner, it’s on you. There are three other power pills still out there. So stay alert.  93 94 95 96 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 65. INT. BLINKY (BRENNER’S CAR) - NIGHT 93 Brenner stops in the middle of the street. Breathing heav feeling the pressure. Maybe feeling like getting out of there. Then...

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: I got this. If I don’t, the world ends. No big deal. Brenner shifts into HIGH GEAR and heads after Pacman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Brenner chases Pacman through the streets we see the sidewalks lined with NEW YORKERS CHEERING HIM ON. Brenner sees this and it really impacts him. He can’t help but sm

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Brenner, he’s leading you directly towards one of the power pills. Get out of there! Up ahead Brenner sees the POWER PILL. Pacman HEADS FOR IT Brenner SLAMS on the brakes. He is about to throw it in reverse and get out of there. But then he STOPS. Gets ano idea. He TURNS THE CAR AROUND and then just SITS THERE. INT. MANHATTAN —- STAGING AREA - NIGHT 95 They all watch, nervous, on the monitor as Pacman eats th pill. And Brenner is just sitting there. NOT MOVING.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: What the hell is he doing? EXT. MANHATTAN STREET —- CONTINUOUS 96 Powered up Pacman TURNS TOWARD Brenner, who still WAITS.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: One, two...

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET, (OVER THE COMMS)
dialogues.text: Dammit, Brenner, I have a son who I would like to see grow up. GET OUT OF THERE!!! Pacman HEADS for Brenner, who THROWS IT IN GEAR and TAKES OFF. BACKWARDS. Pacman is RACING TOWARD HIM. Brenner REVE INTO A PARKING GARAGE and KEEPS COUNTING.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: You’1l see your boy grow up... Four, five...  97 98 99 100 101 102 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenner DRIVES IN REVERSE, as Pacman chases him UP the ra of the garage, sending debris and pixelated RUBBLE everywhere. INT. BLINKY (BRENNER’S CAR) - NIGHT 98 Brenner KEEPS COUNTING. Sweat rolls down his face.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: .--Seven, eight... Pacman is GAINING by the second. And Brenner is NOT DIVIN OUT.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: BRENNER GET OUT, IT’S GOING TO EAT YOU! INT. BLINKY (BRENNER’S CAR) -— CONTINUOUS 100 Brenner looks back, sees that he’s reached the TOP OF THE GARAGE. Heading backwards toward a GUARD RAIL. SEVERAL STORIES in the air. He CAN’T STOP IN TIME.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: .--Nine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenner’s car CRASHES through the guard rail, flying thro the air, between the rooftops of TWO BUILDINGS. Pac-Man S OUT behind him, OPENS his mouth, about to EAT Brenner’s M Cooper...

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Ten. And with that THE MINI-COOPER TURNS BLUE. PAC-MAN CAN’T S HE CHOMPS DOWN ON BRENNER’S CAR, exactly as the same mome as POWERED UP PACMAN’S POWER RUNS OUT. Pacman DISSOLVES, SCREAMS. BOOOO-OOP! We hear the noises Pacman DIES. IT’S HIS THIRD DEATH! We hear the game over/victory noise. THE GUYS WIN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenner’s car SLAMS down onto the opposite rooftop, SPINS a stop and DRIVES OUT of the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Command Center erupts in CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 103 104 105 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 67. INT. MATTY’S DAD'S HOUSE - NIGHT 103 * Matty is watching this on TV with his DAD and SINNAMON. MATTY’S DAD That guy’s gotta lot of balls to pull a maneuver like that. That was pretty phenomenal. *

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Yeah. His name’s Sam Brenner. He * installed our new home theater. Mom's in love with him. Matty’s Dad immediately looks jealous. Sinnamon looks mad that he’s jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and his wife watch this happily on TV.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: That’s our second win. We're all tied up, baby!

dialogues.speaker: FIRST LADY
dialogues.text: That's so great. Can Sarah’s family come with us to the Vineyard this summer?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: Huh? Sure. I guess. What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenner gets out of the Cooper and sees the people of New cheering. A JEEP pulls up, and a wet Eddie Plant in a rob gets out.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: You’re pretty good, Brenner. Not as good as me, but pretty good. They shake hands. As Brenner and Eddie are being mobbed by well-wishers, Lu emerges from the crowd with something hidden under a blan

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: I think I found our “trophy”. He lifts the blanket so the other guys can see - it’s a fidgety, grumbling, 3 feet tall Q-BERT. He’s pretty cute.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Holy crap, it’s Q-Bert!  106 107 108 109 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 68.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: Can I kill it? Q-Bert makes an extra-sad face.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: No! Leave him alone. Maybe later, I don’t know. Hide that thing! I want to play with that later... Ludlow pulls the blanket down over Q-Bert as the apprecia crowd closes in on them.

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO
dialogues.text: A flatscreen TV. NEWS REPORT in progress. 106

dialogues.speaker: NEWS REPORTER
dialogues.text: After yesterday’s victory over Pac- Man in New York, the Arcaders spent the day practicing for their final battle... CHANNEL CHANGES to a different NEWS SHOW. 107

dialogues.speaker: ANCHOR
dialogues.text: A large spacecraft has been detected near Jupiter - and it’s heading toward Earth. There is speculation that the aliens are coming to watch the final game in person, or in alien, I guess... CHANNEL CHANGES to Shep and Megyn. 108

dialogues.speaker: SHEP SMITH
dialogues.text: The space ship is expected to arrive here in three days...

dialogues.speaker: MEGYN KELLY
dialogues.text: -..and what the aliens will find is a President whose approval ratings have skyrocketed. CHANNEL CHANGES to Cooper addressing a news conference. 1

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: I would urge everyone to carry on business as usual. I have every confidence in the Arcaders to meet the final challenge... A REPORTER calls out from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Thank you for saving us, Mr. President!  Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 69. The rest of the reporters break into applause. Cooper smi

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: Don't thank me; it’s the Arcaders who have brought us here to the brink of victory. Sam Brenner has assembled an unbeatable team, and we owe them a huge debt of gratitude.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: We understand you’re throwing a soiree in their honor this evening.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: We are, but don’t worry; they’1l have their Arcader suits on under their tuxes, ready to go at a moment’s notice-- INT. ADMIRAL PORTER’S OFFICE - NIGHT 110 TV CLICKS OFF. CAMERA PULLS BACK, we are inside Admiral PORTER'S MILITARY OFFICE. He has been watching the TV. He stares off, deep in thought, TROUBLED. INT. DARPA —- LAB & REC AREA - DAY 111 We are in the same huge room where Ludlow addressed the SEALS. It has been transformed into the ARCADERS HQ: ther are Humvees, light cannons, scary looking tech, along wit loads of arcade games, a gym area and small “hang out” ar where Matty is playing WARWORLD with Brenner.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: There’s no rhyme or reason to these new games. They’re just coming out from everywhere all at once.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: If someone programmed it, there’s a pattern, you just need to find it. In the meantime just shoot the Demon Soldier's spine out of his back.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: So violent. You sure you should be seeing this?

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Yeah, my Mom lets me play these games all the time.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Not you. Him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 70. REVEAL Q-BERT, seated on the couch next to Matty, watchin the screen, shell shocked.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: He does look a little freaked out.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: What’s he doing out of his cage anyway? What if they’re tricking us, and he’s actually a bad guy?

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Come on, Brenner. You think that cutie pie could actually be a bad guy? Q-Bert makes his eyes big and saucery, and makes a cute squeaky noise.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Maybe you should take him on the trampoline for a few minutes? He’s been sitting here all morning.

dialogues.speaker: Q-BERT
dialogues.text: (excited) Trampoline! Trampoline!

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: We'll do that while you go ask my Mom to the ball tomorrow night. He gestures toward the other side of the huge room, where Violet is in work clothes, fine tuning a scary looking gi DIG DUG PUMP pumping up a pixel to giant size. Michael th Robot is helping her.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: She looks pretty busy working on that Dig-Dug pump...

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Believe me, she’s going. She tried on five dresses this morning. She’s dying to celebrate.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: I don’t know what we're celebrating. We haven’t won yet. (a beat) Did your mom say she wanted me to ask her?

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: No. But if you don’t ask her, you know Eddie will...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 71. He gestures toward another part of the huge room, where E and Ludlow are playing “Space Invaders” side-by-side. Edd is yelling at the machine. *

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: You're hurting my ears! Stop * yelling! *

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Whatever. What if I’m not attracted to your mother? Matty gives him an are-you-kidding look. So does Q-Bert.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright, alright. Matty and Q-Bert run off to an area in the far corner of room, where a small workout area (including a trampoline) been set up. Both climb on and begin jumping up and down. Brenner takes a deep breath and walks over to Violet, who tightening a bolt. INT. DARPA —- LAB AREA — CONTINUOUS A112 *

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER VIOLET
dialogues.text: Hi. Hi.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah... So...

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: So...

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL THE ROBOT
dialogues.text: So... Brenner and Violet look at him. MICHAEL THE ROBOT (CONT’D) Um, I’m gonna go charge up. Michael leaves.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: So this thing tomorrow night, I feel kind * of obligated to make an appearance, and I was thinking, if you were gonna be there too, then when you get there, we could, you know, hang out together.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Like a date?  Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 72.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: No, nothing like that, just... yeah, that. A date. In the BG, we see Matty jumping on the trampoline to prop Bert to crazy heights, where he does flip after flip.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: (teasing) Um... I don’t know. You did say that I was “snobby”, and had “mental problems”.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Well, let’s face it, you do, but I’m willing to overlook that. In the background, Q-Bert bounces so high his head gets caught in the ceiling. He makes his funny “game over” sou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge gala. A swing band plays a jaunty tune. But then t band stops, mid-song, and quickly begins playing “Hail to Chief”. The President has arrived. He is accompanied by Brenner and the First Lady; all are enthusiastically applauded.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: I wish they played my theme song every time I walked into a party.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: That would be cool, but most orchestras don’t know “The Safety Dance”. (points) Glad to see Ludlow and his mom made it. CUT TO Ludlow and HIS MOM at the buffet table. She’s snea chicken tenders into her purse.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: Mom, everyone can see you doing that!

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW'S MOM
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, Luddie. What’s the difference if we eat them now or later? Put some tartar sauce in your pocket. BACK TO BRENNER, COOPER and the FIRST LADY.  Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 73.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST LADY
dialogues.text: I’m dying to meet Sam’s new love interest. Is she pretty, Will?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: Uh, define “pretty”. I mean, you're pretty, extremely pretty, and she’s, I mean, in a sense, certainly for a military-- (looks up, sees something) She's a ten. What he sees is Violet walking in, in her full dress unif She looks amazing. She’s holding hand with Matty, who’s i tux.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Q-Bert! Matty sees Q-Bert, also in a tux (with a bandage on his head), getting down on the dance floor, and runs to play him. Brenner walks over to Violet, and salutes.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Hi. You look nice.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Thanks. I know we’re on duty, and could get the call at any time, but Chewie says I’m allowed have half a beer. Want to split one with me?

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Lead the way. As Brenner and Violet walk off, we see Eddie Plant walk i with JAMIE LEE CURTIS. A burly SECRET SERVICE AGENT stand between them.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: Well looky here, a big party to thank me for saving the world! And you get to stand next to me all night. How does that feel?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE LEE CURTIS
dialogues.text: Real special, Eddie. (to Secret Service Agent) They said they’d give me an island if I did this. CUT TO PROFESSOR IWATANI dancing with Jennifer the Assist “raising the roof” with one hand missing.  113 113pt Numbered Script (04/17/2014)
113 Brenner and Violet are on the outskirts of the party, sha a beer.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: So what’s this Sinnamon look like?

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: What do you mean? She’s a husband- stealing yoga teacher. She’s hot!

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Not that hot though, right? Girls like that, who go with older guys, always have one thing wrong with them, like big nostrils or a huge forehead or something.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: No, Sinnamon is pretty much perfect... except her eyes are too far apart. She kind of looks like a flounder.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Boom, there it is. Tonight, he’s gonna be looking into those eyes, thinking, “What happened? I used to look into the most gorgeous eyes in the world, now I’m stuck with Goggle-Eyes McGee.”

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Did you just say I had gorgeous eyes?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: While insulting the other chick.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Oh, you’re good. BACK NEAR THE DANCE FLOOR, Cooper is watching his wife dance with Ludlow (eyes closed, head resting on her shoulder), when Ludlow’s Mom walks over. LUDLOW’S MOM I don’t mean to bother you, Mr. President, but I wanted to say how proud I am of you.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lamonsoff, you can call me Will, you’ve known me since I was 12.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW'S MOM
dialogues.text: Thank you, President Will of America, sir. See? You haven’t changed. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 113pt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 113pt2 113pt3 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) LUDLOW’S MOM (CONT'D) You're still the same good boy you always were. When they say that nonsense on the news, about how you make bad decisions and you’re maybe a little slow and a coward and too unattractive for such a pretty wife, I just say, “I'd like to see you do better, Mr. News Man.” You gonna finish that shrimp? On the cocktail plate Cooper is holding, among several 75. discarded shrimp tails, is one shrimp with a bite taken o Cooper hands it to Ludlow’s Mom. AT THE BAR, Eddie is chatting up Jamie Lee Curtis, the Secret Service Agent hovering nearby.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: People talk about Brenner this and Brenner that, but make no mistake: the Fire Blaster’s the leader of this crew--

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE LEE CURTIS
dialogues.text: Who's the Fire Blaster again?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: Me, Jamie Lee! You know, Fire Blaster’s been in prison for 8 years. Haven't been with a woman since ‘05. You’re in for a real treat tonight.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE LEE CURTIS
dialogues.text: You're not going to touch me.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: Alright. (to himself) Shoulda gone with Swift. At least I woulda got a song written about what a tool I is.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: So can I ask you a question? And I promise this has nothing to do with my alleged snobbiness... But I’ve seen what you’re capable of these past few weeks. So how come you’re setting up people’s home entertainment systems for a living?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I never really was great at anything except video games, and it turned out I wasn’t even the best at that... 113pt2 113pt3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 76. QUICK CUT TO Eddie, dancing sexy to impress Jamie Lee Cur

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: So you don’t think you’re good at anything unless you're the best in the world at it?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: No, I just... I had my shot, I blew it and now I am who I am, and I’m comfortable with that.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: That sounds like a cop-out. I had the worst acne in the lower 48 states when I was 15, and I didn’t curl up in a ball and cry.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Oh no, am I about to learn a lesson?

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Sorry, no. I just think you have a lot of talents you don’t give yourself credit for. My son says you're the only cool adult he’s ever met.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: You and your boy were talking about me? I like that.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, I’ve been asking around about you. I also spoke to the President...

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: That you’re a great guy. Anda loyal friend. And a lightweight drinker. But I already knew all that.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Did he also tell you about my reputation as a really good kisser?

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Amazing kisser is what you said to me in the closet. But no, that he didn’t mention. I guess if I hadn't snobbishly shut you down, I'd know for sure by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: es

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 77.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Well here comes your last chance to find out... *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 113pt4 And with that Brenner moves in for a kiss. But he’ interrupted by sound of tinkling glasses. The President h an announcement.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, I am proud to introduce a special message to the Arcaders from the students of PS 159 in New York City! Large TV screens surrounding the party flicker to life. T display images of smiling SCHOOLKIDS, dressed in mini-Arc outfits. *

dialogues.speaker: SCHOOLKIDS
dialogues.text: New York was in trouble, Pac Man caused a ruckus, But the Arcaders saved us, Cause they’re bad mother-- But the images flicker and distort into 80’s era DARYL HA and JOHN OATES.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL HALL, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: People of earth: you have violated the rules of warfare. Because of this, you forfeit and your planet is now (STATIC) ours.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: “Violated the rules?” What the hell does that mean? Eddie nervously gulps his drink.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN OATES, (ON THE TV)
dialogues.text: In twelve hours, we will commence * with the all-out destruction of Earth. After that, we will sing this about your precious planet...

dialogues.speaker: DARYL HALL, (ON THE TV)
dialogues.text: She’s go-o-o-o-o0-o-one! The TV’s go dark. People begin murmuring, upset. Admiral PORTER turns on Brenner, accusatory.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL PORTER
dialogues.text: What did you do?  Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 78.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: I didn’t do anything. I don’t know what they’re talking about. I thought we obeyed every rule--

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL PORTER
dialogues.text: You thought wrong, civilian! We wasted our one chance on you, a hi- fi repairman! You were given every available resource, and still you fumbled!

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: But I--

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL PORTER
dialogues.text: But nothing! You heard Hall and Oates: you blew it! I’ve seen your file: you’ve never accomplished a damn thing in your life! And your streak continues!

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: That’s enough, Admiral. We tried something, it didn’t work. Now we have to prepare for an invasion... LUDLOW’S MOM Let’s ask Jamie Lee! She knows how to deal with aliens!

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE LEE CURTIS
dialogues.text: There’s only one thing we can do... As Jamie Lee grabs a bottle of Jim Beam off the bar, and starts chugging, Eddie is quietly backing away. Cooper, Violet, Admiral Porter and others huddle together discuss the invasion.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: How many light cannons do we currently have?

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL PORTER
dialogues.text: I think we need to forget the light sabers and the Vulcan death grips and focus on a conventional military response.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: We know that won’t work.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL PORTER
dialogues.text: No, Lieutenant, nothing you’ve done has worked. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 114 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 79.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL PORTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sometimes I wonder if you’re not working for the Martians yourself.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Drop dead, Porter.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL PORTER
dialogues.text: Consider yourself relieved of your command! (turns to Cooper) Mr. President, we need to prepare our entire nuclear arsenal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the ballroom, there is a large brick terrace. Edd quietly exits the party and creeps across the terrace until...

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Going someplace, Fireblaster? Matty is sitting on a stone bench.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah. Jamie Lee is all over my jock, but it’s kind of turning me off - you know, needy actresses - so I just thought I’d--

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Up/up/left/down/up/right. The Pac Man cheat code for super speed.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you’re talking about, kid. Matty puts on sunglasses. Eddie’s sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: A cop fished these out of the East River the night you fell in, and gave them to me to return to you. I was going to give them back to you today, but then I saw some interesting things written on the inside of the lenses. (dramatically takes off glasses) You're a cheater.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Who’s a cheater? We see that the doors to the party are open, and Brenner, Ludlow, Violet and Iwatani are standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 80. Eddie walks back toward them as he speaks, getting emotio

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: Okay, it was me... I used cheat codes back in the day to help me dominate. So I figured, why not use ‘em when we fought Pac-Man in New York - and it worked! I zipped across half the city in no time!

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: It didn’t work. Cause now we’re all gonna die.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE PLANT
dialogues.text: I didn’t know! I wanted to win! (points to Iwakani) Why’d you have to make the game so hard? Why?!

dialogues.speaker: MATTY. FEAR FILLS HIS EYES AS HE BEGINS RISING IN THE AIR

dialogues.text: Lady Lisa. When you guys saved the world... You kinda’ destroyed his.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Sorry about that, Lud. But ya’ know, we had to do what was best for the other 7 or so billion people out there. Ludlow nods, sadly, notices Q-Bert.  132 133 134 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 97.

dialogues.speaker: LUDLOW
dialogues.text: So how come he’s still alive?

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Q-Bert’s a trophy. I guess we get to keep trophies. Ludlow nods. Dejected. Then Q-bert starts jumping up and excitedly. He RE-PIXELATES INTO... LADY LISA. Ludlow runs and kisses her. Everybody is touched, except Brenner.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: No one else is weirded out right now? A group of PRESS PEOPLE run across the lawn toward them.

dialogues.speaker: PRESS PERSON
dialogues.text: Mr. President, are we out of danger?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: Yes. In fact, I am pleased to announce that I have brokered a peace treaty with the Alien Invaders. INT. MATTY’S DAD’S HOUSE - DAY 132

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER, (ON THE TV)
dialogues.text: This peace was due to and only due to the bravery of the Arcaders, who against all odds stepped up and saved us all. INT. ADMIRAL PORTERS’S OFFICE - DAY 133 Admiral Porter, unshaven and in sweats, sneers at the TV.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER, (ON THE TV)
dialogues.text: They faced the doubters and the naysayers, and came up big when we needed them most. Admiral Porter flips the bird at the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenner, Eddie, Ludlow, Violet and Matty are watching Coo finish his speech.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT COOPER
dialogues.text: Sam Brenner, Ludlow Lamonsoff and Eddie Plant are American heroes. World heroes.  135 136 Numbered Script (04/17/2014) 98. The assembled press cheers. Violet turns to Brenner.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: “World hero?” I guess you’re never gonna’ finish installing my home theater system now.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: I might be able to fit you ina week from Tuesday.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Can’t you do it any sooner? I'11l make it worth your while... Violet and Brenner kiss. CAMERA CRANES BACK, as Cooper an all of them are congratulated by the celebratory crowd, swarming them, thanking them. Eddie, standing off by himself, away from the others, a lonely moment... He turns, starts to exit. His phone BUZZ Eddie glances to the text: Hey, Hero. Meet me in the Lincoln Bedroom. Eddie looks to the White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing in a second floor window, dressed in a negligee, by candlelight, is Jamie Lee Curtis. She gives a flirty w a sexy smile, to Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie smiles, touched, a bit excited. He moves forward, toward the White House. A hand stops him in his tracks. E looks up. It’s TAYLOR SWIFT. Standing directly in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR SWIFT
dialogues.text: Where do you think you’re going? Taylor Swift plants a long, intense, passionate KISS on Eddie’s lips.
